console.description: Klayr interactive REPL session to run commands.

hash-onion.description: Create hash onions to be used by the forger.

count.name: count
count.description: Total number of hashes to produce

pretty.name: pretty
pretty.description: Prints JSON in pretty format rather than condensed.

data-path.name: data-path
data-path.description: Directory path to specify where node data is stored. Environment variable "KLAYR_DATA_PATH" can also be used.

network.name: network
network.description: Default network config to use. Environment variable "KLAYR_NETWORK" can also be used.

config.name: config
config.description: File path to a custom config. Environment variable "KLAYR_CONFIG_FILE" can also be used.

overwrite-config.name: overwrite-config
overwrite-config.description: Overwrite network configs if they exist already

port.name: port
port.description: Open port for the peer to peer incoming connections. Environment variable "KLAYR_PORT" can also be used.

api-ipc.name: api-ipc
api-ipc.description: Enable IPC communication. This will load plugins as a child process and communicate over IPC. Environment variable "KLAYR_API_IPC" can also be used.

api-ws.name: api-ws
api-ws.description: Enable websocket communication for api-client. Environment variable "KLAYR_API_WS" can also be used.

api-http.name: api-http
api-http.description: Enable HTTP communication for api-client. Environment variable "KLAYR_API_HTTP" can also be used.

api-port.name: api-port
api-port.description: Port to be used for api-client. Environment variable "KLAYR_API_PORT" can also be used.

api-host.name: api-host
api-host.description: Host to be used for api-client. Environment variable "KLAYR_API_HOST" can also be used.

log.name: log
log.description: Log level. Environment variable "KLAYR_LOG_LEVEL" can also be used.

seed-peers.name: seed-peers
seed-peers.description: Seed peers to initially connect to in format of comma separated "ip:port". IP can be DNS name or IPV4 format. Environment variable "KLAYR_SEED_PEERS" can also be used.

enable-forger-plugin.name: enable-forger-plugin
enable-forger-plugin.description: Enable Forger Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_FORGER_PLUGIN" can also be used.

enable-monitor-plugin.name: enable-monitor-plugin
enable-monitor-plugin.description: Enable Monitor Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_MONITOR_PLUGIN" can also be used.

monitor-plugin-port.name: monitor-plugin-port
monitor-plugin-port.description: Port to be used for Monitor Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_MONITOR_PLUGIN_PORT" can also be used.

monitor-plugin-whitelist.name: monitor-plugin-whitelist
monitor-plugin-whitelist.description: List of IPs in comma separated value to allow the connection. Environment variable "KLAYR_MONITOR_PLUGIN_WHITELIST" can also be used.

enable-report-misbehavior-plugin.name: enable-report-misbehavior-plugin
enable-report-misbehavior-plugin.description: Enable ReportMisbehavior Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_REPORT_MISBEHAVIOR_PLUGIN" can also be used.

enable-faucet-plugin.name: enable-faucet-plugin
enable-faucet-plugin.description: Enable Faucet Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_FAUCET_PLUGIN" can also be used.

faucet-plugin-port.name: faucet-plugin-port
faucet-plugin-port.description: Port to be used for Faucet Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_FAUCET_PLUGIN_PORT" can also be used.

enable-dashboard-plugin.name: enable-dashboard-plugin
enable-dashboard-plugin.description: Enable Dashboard Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_DASHBOARD_PLUGIN" can also be used.

dashboard-plugin-port.name: dashboard-plugin-port
dashboard-plugin-port.description: Port to be used for Dashboard Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_DASHBOARD_PLUGIN_PORT" can also be used.

enable-chain-connector-plugin.name: enable-chain-connector-plugin
enable-chain-connector-plugin.description: Enable Chain Connector Plugin. Environment variable "KLAYR_ENABLE_CHAIN_CONNECTOR_PLUGIN" can also be used.

genesis-block-url.name: genesis-block-url
genesis-block-url.description: The URL to download the genesis block. Environment variable "KLAYR_GENESIS_BLOCK_URL" can also be used. Kindly ensure that the provided URL downloads the genesis block 'blob' in the tarball format.

overwrite-genesis-block.name: overwrite-genesis-block
overwrite-genesis-block.description: Download and overwrite existing genesis block. Environment variable "KLAYR_GENESIS_BLOCK_OVERWRITE" can also be used.

block:get.description: Get block information for a given id or height.

data-path.description: Directory path to specify where node data is stored. Environment variable "KLAYR_DATA_PATH" can also be used.

pretty.description: Prints JSON in pretty format rather than condensed.

args.name: input
args.description: Height in number or block id in hex format.

output.description: Directory path to specify where snapshot is downloaded. By default outputs the files to current working directory.
